bibl.title: The Boy Strangling the Goose: Genre Figure or Mythological Symbol? Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: A lectio Aegyptiaca of the sculpture: the child is the personification of Dionysos/Harpokrates, the goose is an evil spirit over which the Divine Child triumphs. - P. 644: HERODAS, Mim. IV, 31.
bibl.seg: RIDGWAY Brunilde S., The Boy Strangling the Goose: Genre Figure or Mythological Symbol? Avec résumé en anglais.
A lectio Aegyptiaca of the sculpture: the child is the personification of Dionysos/Harpokrates, the goose is an evil spirit over which the Divine Child triumphs. - P. 644: HERODAS, Mim. IV, 31.
